channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Michigan Citizen-Only Voting Effort Kicks Off Under Watch Of ‘Terrible’ Elections Chief
item.description: Leftist Secretary of State Jocelyn Benson has insisted that there's no need for such an election-integrity amendment.

item.title: Intel CEO expected to visit White House after Trump calls for his resignation

item.title: How Teachers Can Dismantle the Teachers’ Unions
item.description: Empowering teachers and parents to starve the beast and break the monopoly.

item.title: Harvard Might Create a Conservative Center. Is It Real or Just Window Dressing?
item.description: There are five indicators to watch for to confirm whether Harvard is serious about intellectual diversity.

item.title: There Aren’t Data to Support Anti-Natalism
item.description: Children are precious and valued as human beings, regardless of where their careers lead them.

item.title: Report: 3 In 5 Veterans Treated For PTSD Are On At Least Two Psych Meds
item.description: Portions of the VA medical staff seem to have settled upon powerful narcotics as a way to keep suffering patients churning through the pipeline.

item.title: Retail spending surged in July despite fears
item.description: Retail spending was robust in July as consumers snapped up summer sales and wages grew above the rate of inflation, a monitor's report said Monday.

item.title: Live Tomorrow’s Joy Today
item.description: Herald hope for people who are drowning in hopelessness.

item.title: Man Allegedly Murdered His Unborn Baby By Spiking Her Mom’s Hot Cocoa With Abortion Drug
item.description: Even before Liana Davis confirmed she was pregnant, Christopher Cooprider reportedly insisted he would 'like to get rid of it.'

item.title: Art and absurdity of redrawing congressional lines -- and then crossing them
item.description: We've come a long way from the country's first-ever gerrymander, which involved two future presidents vying to get elected to the first Congress.
